location.address: 30 W Broadway, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA

businessProfile.name: Padeli's Street Greek
businessProfile.address: 30 W Broadway, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
businessProfile.formatted_address: 30 W Broadway, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA

reviews.text: I don't love the toppings limit for the price but it was delicious!  Definitely go with tziki the hummus was just okay

I got the greek salad which tasted amazing and was exactly what i expected, but the workers behind the counter were hard to communicate with. I also chose not to dine in because the tables and floors looked somewhat dirty. Also, after reading other peoples reviews im sure the only reason they got my order right was because i was actually inside the restraunt. Overall, id say i might go here again if i was in the area already, but since theres better greek restraunts in SLC it wouldnt be my first choice

This is THE WORST Greek my husband and I have ever had. I don't know if it's because we came at the end of the day or if it's because it's just been sitting out all day. The pita bread was hard and stale. It was so bad I couldn't bare another bite. The lamb/beef meat was also hard and cold and flavorless. I had some of the fries from my children's plate and that was alright. It was hard to hear the person behind the counter when I was ordering, and thats with barely any people in the place. Definitely don't recommend this place and we'll never be coming back.

I've been a regular to-go customer for at least a year. Frequently, things I order are missing ingredients. No huge deal. But today, I was so disgusted to discover my half and half bowl had some sort of yellow sauce all over it that tasted like curry. I looked on the menu and learned that the only thing it could be is mustard. YUCK! On top of the mustard as if to "hide" it was the actual sauce I ordered (creamy sriracha). SO that meant that not only did I get mustard on my bowl (eww) but it basically had double sauce on it. It was like a soup. Completely inedible. So gross!! Sad to say but I won't be ordering here again. To the staff if you mess something up I recommend simply remaking it instead of sending it to one of your loyal customers.

Quality, fresh Greek food. Options like going to Qdoba... but Greek style. I had the bowl (sound familiar? ) with rice, garbanzo beans, lamb beef kabob... plus pita, toppings and sauce.  Watching them use a caulking gun to squirt out the sauce was a bit unnerving...  Make it a combo and you get a side and drink. Plenty to eat and a nice alternative to a burger place. Customer operated soda machine takes a while to make a selection from many, many drink options and a line quickly forms. Most first time customers were a bit confused ordering as I was. If you don't know what it is or includes... ask. Menu on board is not very clear for new customers even if you have been to Greece.
Seating could be more inviting like it is in Greece rather than a subway sandwich place. They do have limited outside seating for nice weather.
Competition across the street probably keeps them doing their best.
Greek music playing was a novel idea.
Overall good food and I would go back... after trying across the street just to see what that is all about and make another review 🙄

editorial_summary.overview: No-frills joint focusing on traditional Greek gyros, salads, wraps & sides plus imported sodas.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customer opinions are divided. The 3.0/5 rating from 5 recent reviews suggests some great experiences mixed with areas needing attention.

strengthsPerceived: Customers appreciate the quality and freshness of the Greek food, which offers a unique alternative to typical fast food options. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The restaurant's Greek music adds a novel and authentic touch to the dining experience, making it memorable for customers. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The option to customize meals, similar to popular fast-casual chains, appeals to customers looking for personalized dining experiences. - Boostly marketing services can amplify this
improvementOpportunities: Difficulty communicating with staff and unclear menu for new customers - social media marketing can improve this area
Negative reviews about food quality and order accuracy - review management can address this concern
Lack of inviting ambiance and competition awareness - social media marketing can improve this area
